actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that an individual may qualify for disability insurance benefits and the disability freeze if he has enough quarters of coverage to be fully insured for old-age benefit purposes, regardless of when such quarters were earned.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Provides under title II (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) that an individual may qualify for disability insurance benefits and the disability freeze, under title II of the Social Security Act, if he has enough quarters of coverage to be fully insured for old-age benefit purposes, regardless of when such quarters were earned. Sets forth a formula for the reduction of benefits if a person begins receiving such benefits in a month before his retirement age is reached.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that an individual may qualify for disability insurance benefits and the disability freeze if he has enough quarters of coverage to be fully insured for old-age benefit purposes, regardless of when such quarters were earned.
